intro: Anneslia rhodocephala, commonly known as the red-headed angel's trumpet, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain toxic seeds, a feature common among members of its family. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded or semi-shaded areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though caution is advised due to its poisonous nature.
